clinical_study.official_title: The COURAGE Trial: Colon Recurrence and Aerobic Exercise: A Feasibility Study.

lead_sponsor.agency: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

clinical_study.source: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

brief_summary.textblock: Despite the success of surgery and chemotherapy among people with colon cancer, 30-50% of patients develop recurrent disease. Physical activity has emerged as a potential lifestyle intervention to reduce cancer recurrence and improve survival among people with colon cancer (CC). This pilot study aims to identify the dose-response effects of aerobic exercise on molecular and cellular pathways associated with physical activity and CC outcomes among patients with stage II and III CC.

primary_outcome.measure: 1. The biological efficacy of aerobic exercise on soluble intercellular adhesion molecule-1 (sICAM-1), and soluble vascular adhesion molecule-1 (sVCAM-1) prognostic biomarkers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Exercise adherence, quantified as the percentage of total dose completed relative to the total dose prescribed during the six-month study;
Visceral adipose tissue and anthropometric measures at baseline and six-months;
Fasting insulin measured at baseline and six-months;
Circulating tumor cells measured at baseline and six-months.
